address.streetAddress: 92-95 Front St E St. Lawrence Market

description: Toronto eBike city tours are the best way to see the most amount of Toronto attractions in the least time. You won't regret this experience! All eBike city tours are approximately 4 hours in length: Departure times from St. Lawrence Market: 8:30 am, 1 pm & 5:30 pm local times. SEVEN DAYS PER WEEK. Electric bikes simply outperform regular bicycles. They are easy to use, offer three types of bike performance. You're on holiday. Leave the pedaling for the gym when you get home! Your ebike city tour includes: a local city ambassador who will guide you for the tour, give you historical information of all the various tourist attractions along the route, you will receive free unlimited cold bottled water, and you'll be entertainment for the full length of the tour. You're going to have an absolutely awesome experience. You won't regret it!

reviews.title: how much is the price ?
text: i wanted to know how much the price was was for two minors ( 14 and 16 ) and an adult on a wednesday? thank you

reviews.title: Best tour of toronto - hands down
text: This tour was incredible on many fronts!  The e bikes make it easy to enjoy the sights and sounds of toronto.  The bikes are so comfortable and simple to ride and you can use them with little or no pedalling or full peddling, if you wish.  Adam was extremely knowledgable, pleasant and entertaining! My husband planned this for a birthday surprise and we managed to see a number of sites across the city within our tour.  Adam suggested poses and took many memorable photos of us each site that we will treasure!  The pace was set by us, and we enjoyed each site and had the time to fully take it in.  The amazing thing about this tour is you can go with a standard tour of set locations or you can choose from

a suggested roster of points of interest in Toronto.  We went with the standard pre set points of interest and did not regret it!  My husband and I have enjoyed many bike tours and waking yours across the world - this was certainly one of the best!

reviews.title: Unique way to see Toronto!
text: We spent a quality 3.5 hours with the delightful tour guide Adam. He gave us the perfect balance of riding the EBikes, information about his home town and photo ops. We were very happy with the bikes as they allow you to pedal at your desired pace. The power assist adds a fun dimensions to the ride and we covered a fair bit of ground. This is a fun way to explore downtown Toronto and take it all in. We were extremely satisfied with every aspect of our tour and highly recommend you try it!!! 2 thumbs up.

reviews.title: Amazing tour, amazing guide
text: I did this tour with my grown up daughter and we absolutely loved it! The weather wasn't the best but Toronto, the ebikes, and Adam our guide more than made up for it.

We had a short but thorough briefing on the bikes, followed with a double check that we were ok. Then we hit the streets and went pretty much everywhere. We went over the far side of the harbour to get some great skyline views, and then went through the harbourfront, distillery, university and shopping areas and everywhere in between.

Adam set a good pace but was keeping an eye on us, and he is very assertive with the traffic - which was needed in a good few cases. He stopped frequently to chat and give us information, and also to take more photos than I've had on any day since my wedding day.
We were the only people on the tour, and there are never more than four so it will always have a real personal feel.
Overall I would highly recommend this tour, and I'd suggest doing it early in a visit to Toronto as there are lots of places you'll want to go back to.

reviews.title: Best way to see the city
text: My son and I took an afternoon tour with Adam and it was great.  He's lived here all his life and knows Toronto backwards and forwards.  Toronto is becoming very bike-friendly (at least in summer!) and riding an ebike allows you to cover a lot of ground without working up too much of a sweat.  Being out in the open air, really feeling the different environments of Toronto while being guided by a true local makes for a memorable experience. Also, Adam took great pictures for us at all the stops and quickly sent them via email.
Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Toronto eBike City Tours
text: The first day we arrived in Toronto we wanted to see the highlights that the city had to offer.  We did the Toronto ebike City Tours and weren't disappointed.  It was run by Adam who was and excellent and very informative host and covered all the favourite sites the city has to offer.
I would highly recommend the tour as you would not be disappointed.

reviews.title: Great day!  Adam was fun, knew the city and we felt safe riding with him.
text: Highly recommend the ebike tour.  I would definitely go again and recommend it.  Adam pointed out Toronto land marks and fun information about this wonderful city.   He was also flexible regarding staying longer at an attraction and was always taking pictures to provide us with memories.  Thanks Adam I will see you again.

reviews.title: Fun way to explore Toronto
text: I really enjoyed this tour! We were only in Toronto for a long weekend, so it was an awesome way to cover a lot of ground in one evening. The bike was surprisingly easy to use. Although I commute to work via bike, I was a little nervous about how an eBike would function- but it's incredibly easy and super fun! Adam was a great tour guide - he was knowledgeable, friendly, had many insights into the city's history and showed us around some neighborhoods that we never would have found on our own. He also took photos throughout the tour and shared them with us which was a really nice touch. I highly recommend it!

reviews.title: great tour
text: best bike tour ever. adam is great. they keep the group size down and the electric bikes allow you to see more of the city

reviews.title: The Best e bike tour we have ever done.
text: It was just perfect.
Adam was Great!!! Answered all our questions, he was so kind, polite, smiling and gave us such a good feeling all the tour.
We try to go to every e bike  tour in every city we are staying in because it's the perfect way to see many things in just a few hours.
We have to say,  this e bike tour is on our Top 3 tours we have beer in all around the would.
Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Not for everybody...
text: Me and my girlfriend went on a 2 hours ebike tour with Adams at the end of August 2015. It was the first time we were trying the electric bike.
We made our reservation by phone directly with Adam for the same day. He asked us to meet him at their office on Berkeley St.
Upon ou arrival there, we where surprised there was no sign of Toronto ebike city tour or even an office place. There was only few bikes attached after a tree on the sidewalk.

Adam showed up few minutes later and greeted us. He called his assistant who was upstair in a messy appartment which was used as their office. It was full on stuff and boxes all over the place. I had to follow his assistant uptstairs to pay, and the only way I could pay was by going on their website and filling the online form and paying through paypal.. They don't have the direct payment machine.
We then took our ebike and crossed the street where Adam adjust the seats and took 2 minutes to show us how the ebike works.

It has been few years that my girlfriend didn't ride a bike and she never did it in a big city, trough traffic. Even though our guide noticed she wasn't confortable after the short test ride, he never took time to explain how to change speed, brakes, and electric assistance. He didn't not gave us any instructions about signals to so into traffic (left turn, right turn, stop...)

After a 5 minutes ride, where my girlfriend's battery unhooked 2 times and made her almost fell, we stopped at the Distillery dsitrict for some exploration and pictures. We had to walk with our bike through the district and then arrive at a traffic light where we had to cross a busy intersection.

While we were stll trying to get used to the electric bike, our guide made us cross dangerously a 6 lanes boulevard and a train track throught traffic... We got hunked by some cars and even for me, who is used to bike in downtown Montreal, it was a bit scary!
After this adventure, we asked our guide to only bike in the bike path by the lake instead of following the guided tour in town, which would have made us cross many intersections throught traffic...
From this moment, the ride was much more pleasant and relax, even if the bike path was very busy and our guide was riding way too fast, sometimes at 30 km/h!

Overall, the bike are very easy and fun to ride when you get used to them after a few minutes. The wheather was very nice and we did bike for about 30 km, which allowed us to take some nice pictures, even if we didn't visit any of the attractions we were supposed to. Our guide Adam took many pictures of us and sent them all the same day by email.
Maybe Toronto is a too busy and spead city to appreciate this bike tour, especially if you're not an experimented biker in big city...

reviews.title: Best way to feel and see the city of Toronto!
text: Thanks to Adam and his perfect e-bikes! Very enthusiastic business owners who were very happy to help us get on our way. The place looks like a normal home and there's no sign, so we didn't find it right away but the address mentioned above checks out.

reviews.title: Awesome trip around Toronto !!!!
text: I would highly recommend this tour for anyone interested in seeing Toronto in a fun way.  We are a family of four ( kids ages 14 +16) and had an afternoon to explore Toronto. I found Toronto eBikes on trip advisor and was excited about the tour. Adam who runs the company was a great tour guide and we really enjoyed hanging out with him.  I feel like we not only saw Toronto but we got to really EXPERIENCE this beautiful city. I can't thank Adam enough for a memorable afternoon !

reviews.title: Best way to see Toronto
text: What a great way to see the city. We're young and very fit people, and cycling around for a few hours is likely to lead to tiredness and so a less enjoyable experience. The ebikes allowed us to see lots of the city whilst being outdoors in the sun and not feeling any tiredness. The bikes are very easy to use. Adam, our guide was also good fun to be around and is very knowledgeable about the city. He even kindly provided water and energy bars as snacks and was very flexible with our requirements. We were surprised about how much of the city we actually managed to see in such a short period of time, and none of it felt rushed.
I would highly recommend this tour to everyone.

reviews.title: Best Bike Tour Ever!! Adam is the man!!
text: My friend and I visited Toronto this past weekend and decided to do a quick tour of the city. We are seasoned travelers and exchange students to the U.S. We found Toronto eBike Rentals on Tripadvisor. The bike ride was one of it's kind, it's easy to ride in the midst of the busy traffic in downtown Toronto. We did the tour with Adam. I would highly recommend anyone to do the tour (hands down the best in Canada and probably in America, period!). Wow, What an amazing time!!! I did not paddle as much along the way and used up the battery on my bike but Adam (the tour guide) immediately swap his bike for mine. Amazing guy! Plus, you also get to go to some of the local - less-tourisee  places around the city. For CAD$99, you really can't beat that price! Overall 5/5 star! Will definitely do it again when I'm back in Toronto the next time!

reviews.title: Fun way to explore Toronto
text: We chose the morning tour, covering the East side of Toronto. The business has a bit of a start-up feel to it, which we weren't expecting and it was a little off-putting at first. However, we quickly got over that feeling once the tour started.

Our guide, Adam, made great efforts to make sure we were both comfortable and having fun throughout the tour. You cover A LOT of the city during that 4 hours! We were thankful to have seen so much and ended up finding many places to revisit later, which we weren't even aware of prior to the tour.

We are both overweight and not avid cyclists, so having the electric motor really helped out whenever our legs got tired. I probably could have used the motor throughout the tour more often than I did, as the battery was still fully charged at the end of the tour. So, if you'd hesitate to take this tour because you feel you're out of shape, I would bet you'll be fine on this tour. We would definitely be interested in doing the tour of the West side of Toronto if we're ever back in that city.

reviews.title: You have to try an electronic bike
text: At least once, they are quite fun and easy to use. Adam our tour guide was polite and really loves his city. We biked for 4/5 hours and there is truly a lot to see, especially if it is your first time in Toronto. A great way to get a feel of the city and the way of life.
Wishing Toronto ebike tours the best of luck.

reviews.title: Neat idea and worked great.
text: I was visiting Downtown Toronto and had some time to spare so I gave it a try.  I spoke to Adam and he was very helpful in arranging a booking on short notice and even helped with a tour route.  I have never ridden an electric bike before, very cool.  The bike itself was easy to ride and had plenty of power.   Traffic was more tame than I expected too.
I'm looking forward to another trip to Toronto so I can explore some more of the downtown area.

reviews.title: A new friend
text: I came to Toronto for the first time last week. When I left, I felt like I now have a friend in this awesome city. Adam showed this fascinating and wonderful city to me and my 16-yr old son on a Saturday afternoon. The culture, the architecture, the history of this city is so fascinating! Adam is a great guy: very friendly, knowledgeable, open minded, responsive, flexible, and eager to please. The tour was well worth the money, and more. It was worth the time! Adam showed us so much of the city, and it was so fun zipping along on those electric bikes. We saw more than twice the city that a traditional bike tour would cover in the same amount of time. Adam knows a lot of people in this city, and he knows the history of the city and the interesting sights that we would certainly have missed if we were exploring on our own.
We went over our time, but Adam didn't care, and he never rushed us at any of our stops.
If I ever come back to Toronto, I'll be giving Adam a call. Heck, if I go anywhere in Canada I'll probably call Adam, and I know he'll be glad to help!

reviews.title: Toronto City tour
text: If you want a bit more personal tour of Toronto than a bus tour and if you have only one day or limited stay and want to visit the major city landmarks and sights of Toronto, it's an ideal activity. I was the only one signed up for the tour, so things were very flexible and Adam, the tour guide, was very accommodating throughout the tour.  He took a lot of photos of each stop during the tour and sent them to me later in the evening.  I don't know if this would be possible if there were other parties during the tour.

reviews.title: Best Way To See Toronto!!
text: It was our first time to Toronto and we wanted to see as much of the city as possible.  Our tour was originally scheduled for 8:30 am but due to weather, Adam was happy to move the tour to 1:00 pm so we would have better weather that day.  We meet Adam in front of St. Lawrence market.  After the how "to's" to ride an EBike we were off.  Adam is a life long resident of Toronto and shared his rich knowledge of the city.  We hit a number of sites, that we would have never gotten to, if we were are not on the EBike tour.  He took great photos and emailed them to us the next day.  We really enjoyed our time on this tour!!  We highly recommend this tour no matter if its your first visit to this beautiful city or if you have been to Toronto multiple times.  Thanks to Adam for making our visit so special!!!

reviews.title: An absolutely phenomenal time out in toronto
text: We usually don't do formal tours, but because our time in toronto was limited we decided to do the Toronto E-Bike tour. We had a great time. Our guide Adam was gracious, prompt, informative and entertaining. We had never ridden a E-Bike before but it was easy, fun, and got us around to so many sites in 4 hours that we never would have gotten to otherwise. Adam took great pictures and emailed them to us. He took great care of us, and made sure to watch out for us on the streets. He never once let us out of his sights and watched out for our safety all the time. Adam is absolutely great to go touring toronto with (a life long native)
We usually don't do trip advisor reviews (lack of time), but this was such a great and memorable time. Tip:  Make time to have a meal/snack at the St. Lawrence Market-a unique and fun time.
MUST DO WHILE IN TORONTO

reviews.title: What a fun way to get around Toronto!
text: For Father's day, my 24 year old son rented E-Bikes from Adam for himself, my wife and I.  Our plan was just to tour around Toronto as a family on the bike trails and stop for lunch and/or a beer whenever we felt like it.  The bikes were easy to use and with the battery/motor, they were easy on the legs,  The whole day was a ton of fun and exceeded our expectations.  We were able to travel a lot further than we would have been able to with non powered bikes.  Highly recommend trying it!

reviews.title: Best way to see Toronto--great for all abilities!
text: Thanks to Adam, our tour guide, we have a new best friend in Toronto. He was fantastic, responsive, caring, safety-conscious, an expert on the city he loves, and he gave us an extraordinary view of a beautiful city by electric bicycle. In addition, there wasn't anything Adam wouldn't do to make this experience a wonderful one for us. He took lots of fantastic photos and sent them same-day.You can't go wrong on this tour-- personal and the best way to see the city. It was a blast for all of us-- with different biking abilities. It was a wonderful family activity for all of us. Thank you Adam.

reviews.title: A fun way to see tons of things
text: We did this as one of the first things when we arrived in Toronto as a way to see lots of the city figuring we could come back to things that we wanted to see more of during our trip.  It worked great for this.  Adam brought context to many things we saw taking pictures all along the way and made the experience feel personal.  The ebikes were tons of fun making me wonder how I could sneak it into my next triathlon to improve my times. :)  This may not be the cheapest thing to do in Toronto but we found it to be without question worth the cost.  We would never have seen so much in such a short time.

reviews.title: Toronto bike tour
text: Where to start? I guess with customer service...superb. Easy to reserve, answered  calls promptly. Easy going guide with great sense of humor. On to the tour...so much more than we imagined. Had never been to Toronto and this tour was perfect to see a great majority of touristy stuff, as well as out of the way places. Really feel like we got an amazing introduction to a fantastic city. It was also my first time on an electric bike...OMG. We were able to cover massive amounts of the city. We couldn't have seen half on a typical bike, and would have been knackered. As it was just a fun leisurely peddle about. I can recommend this tour without reservation. The highlight of our Canada vacation, thanks Adam.

reviews.title: Highly recommended
text: My wife and I booked on line.  Tour started exactly as outlined.   We did trip this morning.   What a fantastic full four hours tour!
Our first time ever riding on an electric bike.  We both absolutely loved it, so easy to use.  Wife and I agreed that we're buying one next month.   So easy and enjoyable to ride.

Adam was our tour guide.  We left St. Lawrence Center as scheduled.  He knows everything about the city.  He provided us with free bottled water throughout the trip.  Today was 78 outside.  He led us on an amazing trip. We saw so much of Toronto. Adam was very polite, gave us information at every stop along the.  We saw every stop outlined on their website: Distillery District, Portlands, Greek town, Yorkville, University of Toronto (such history and stunning architecture), China town, Kensington Market, historic Maple Leaf Gardens, Yong & Dundas Square, City hall and the 3D Toronto sign, Financial district, CN Tower, Steamwhistle brewery where we enjoyed a free sample of great beer, hockey hall of fame, and few more I don't remember.
Adam took all our pictures and emailed to us that night as he promised he would.
My wife and I had a fantastic trip!
We both would 'highly recommend' this trip to y'all.
Ben Litman
South Carolina

reviews.title: Flexible guide
text: I've booked the e-bike tour because after my experience in SF with e-bikes I thought to attend the same in Toronto.

After my booking Adam has wrote me to tell me that due to the season they have put all e-bikes a way. He offered my a full refund or a privat bycycle tour. I was a bit skeptic but I decided to go for it.
I have to say in the end I did not regret it.
Adam has showed me in a 4 hours tour the whole city and could tell me all about Toronto and Canada. Thank god we even walked a bit since I was not a regular cycler 😀.
I had a fantastic tour with a very flexible knowledable and very friedly guide. I can recommend the tour!

reviews.title: Amazing way to discover Toronto
text: We had only 2 days to visit the city and were looking for an interesting option to find out about the city without taking the hop on hop off busses,  when we came across adam's ebike tour. We did it on a Sunday morning and had the best of times, loved the places we visited and Adam was the perfect guide knowledgeable about the city and very friendly.

reviews.title: OK but not what we expected
text: Initially we were very excited about this tour. We were originally looking for scooters to rent to show an out of town friend of ours Downtown Toronto. Upon searching we found this website and decided to give them a call to see what they were all about. We spoke to Adam on the phone who explained to us how the tour would work. He seemed very enthusiastic about the whole procedure explaining that there would be many stops along the way where we would stop for pictures, food and drinks. After the conversation with Adam it seemed like the ideal tour to take. Mind we were under the impression that we’d be going to some of the top sightseeing locations and getting to explore the city.

Leading up to the day of the tour we thought that it would be a private guided tour due to the high price and my conversation with Adam. Perhaps we were misunderstood because upon arrival we found out that we were going on the tour with an older lady who seemed to be in her later 40’s.

We met in front of the St. Lawrence Market from where we thought we were going to their office. However, instead we proceeded to a nearby parking garage where he had a couple bikes locked away where there were bike parts, boxes, and clutter everywhere – the whole experience we felt was a little shady.

Before we had even begun the tour we were at the entrance of the parkade when a car tried to pass by us, Adam almost got into an altercation with the drivers because they were trying to drive by us. The bikes looked like they were going to fall apart any second as he was duck taping the batteries to the bike right in front of us. He then showed really quickly how the bikes worked and although the 3 of us picked up on it fairly quickly the older lady accompanying us had a bit of a hard time understanding how the ebikes worked. Despite her confusion and our hesitation, being new bikers in the city, Adam started the tour.

We had explained that though we were comfortable biking in the city we had not done it in a long time, Adam continued to assure us repeatedly that many beginners had been on this tour. After Distillery District we made our way to the Portlands where Adam (an experienced biker) rode far ahead of us, which happened a lot through out the tour, and didn’t look back to see if everyone was okay. After looking through the crowd to find Adam we got off our bikes and walked towards him when the older ladies bike got stuck on throttle and ran over an innocent bystander who was going to Cabana Pool Bar – this made for an embarrassing experience as many people were looking at us.

After this we continued to ride by some of the locations listed on his site. Majority of the tour was just riding by it the sites and him explaining how much houses cost in the neighborhoods and not really stopping to experience any of it. When we spoke on the phone with Adam he explained to us that we’d be stopping at a brewery to get a sample of beer and that we would stop to get a bite to eat at Loblaws. However, neither of these events happened. We were especially disappointed with not stopping to eat at Loblaws because we had been biking for a couple hours at that point and were exhausted. We also did not see the Air Canada Center, Rogers Center, Hockey Hall of Fame, St. James Cathedral, Round House and St. Lawrence Market.

Even though the tour guide seemed friendly and knowledgeable about the city, he did seem a bit insensitive about the different previous biking experiences everyone had. For the future I recommended having a tour guide in the front leading the tour and another in the back to make sure everyone feels safe. Because even though we were younger and were comfortable riding in the city he did not accommodate and was riding at a much faster speed than what we were used to and we felt like we had to keep up. Not to mention that he, on multiple occasions, was cycling between cars very close in proximity. Even the older lady at one point mentioned to us that she regretted going on this tour.

At the end we had to come back because the older lady’s schedule and although Adam offered to take us to Lakeshore we had had enough at that point and did not want to be rude and just wanted to be on our way. For payment we did not want to bring cash with us but we also did not that they didn’t have any direct payment machine options. The only choice was to pay from our phones on paypal.

Overall, I wish I would have just gone with the scooters. The seats were really uncomfortable – my butt still hurts. Also cold water was mentioned but the water was warm. We would sincerely like to be refunded our money as we really don’t feel like it was worth the money.

reviews.title: Great way to see a lot in a short time
text: I went on this tour as a solo traveler and ended up being the only one on the tour for the day. The guide, Adam, met me at the designated meeting place and within 5 minutes the bikes were set up and ready to go. Electric bikes are easy to use and a way to cover a lot of ground that you wouldn't normally be able to do on an ordinary bike. Adam took me all around the Toronto area and was able to explain everything we were looking at and answer my questions as well. I especially liked that he took every opportunity to take photographs at all our stopping points and then emailed all of them to me after the tour. I enjoyed the ease of using an electric bike, seeing the sights and getting a feel for riding on the downtown Toronto streets. Great tour - definitely recommend!

reviews.title: Not what we expected
text: Very high price for just a couple hours , would not recommend. Expected a lot more out of the tour,.

reviews.title: Electrifying tour of Toronto with a dynamo called Adam
text: A really different way to see a city.Adam was so energetic and enthusiastic about his beautiful home city and made sure we really got to see all the sites of interest.I loved the electric bike and am thinking of getting one now! Thanks Adam

reviews.title: Toronto experience of a lifetime
text: My daughter and I booked this tour to show the most of Toronto to a student friend visiting from Austria. I thought I had seen Toronto as I regularly travel there to visit relatives, schools, attractions or social events, but this eBike tour is just the most awesome way to experience the real Toronto. We had other plans to take in Cirque Du Soleil and Toronto Harbour Cruise, so Adam and I exchanged a few emails to set up the perfect time for our eBike tour. He suggested the Sunday morning tour for us and it was absolutely the best timing. We arrived downtown early and parking was easy. The weekend was hot and humid, but the morning tour was refreshing and exciting.

I am 'young at heart', but wear a knee brace for walking, and wondered if my bike inexperience would hinder the success of our tour. Not at all. We all absolutely loved the eBike tour. Adam and Ryan love their city and showed us more in four hours than we could have shown our guest in the whole weekend. We had so much fun with them and enjoyed every minute. Great guides, great tour!!

reviews.title: eBike was a blast!!
text: My wife booked this tour for us. Am I ever glad she did!
An eBike? That's for sissies. I ride "real" bicycles. Who needs an electric assist? Let me tell you - Everybody needs it! You need it if you want to see this much of Toronto in only 4 hours.

The eBike is a super invention. It's very conventional looking and riding. It has gears and pedals and works just like a regular hybrid-style bike. Until you turn on the power, that is. Start to pedal, and and in just a moment, the electric boost eases in and has you up to speed in a snap. You can set it to give you as much or as little boost as you like.

Enough about the bikes. The best part of the tour was our guide, Adam. Adam knows the city and knows how to get from one place to another in a flash. He also know the story behind every neighborhood, street, and building that he takes you to. Plus he takes photos, answers stupid tourist questions, and keeps an eye on his customers.

Okay, some more about the eBikes... This tour has a lot of stop and go. So much so, that anyone short of a serious athlete might run out of legs pretty quickly on regular bikes. The eBike makes this sort of tour possible.

reviews.title: Great experience and wonderful way to see the city
text: This was our first time on the eBikes and we loved them.  The tour was terrific and Adam was a great guide. He was so knowledgeable about all of the town, history, and really a people person. The trip was 4 hours and the eBikes' made that doable for a more mature couple with recent knee issues(me).  Adam took pictures throughout and emailed them to us.  My husband and I were the only ones on the tour and we got very personal service.  I would recommend this to anyone who likes bikes and wants to see the city in a unique and fun way.

reviews.title: Awesome way to see the city in 4 short hours!
text: This was an awesome tour and Adam is a great hospitable tour guide.  Our tour had some technical challenges, but Adam quickly resolved the issues and was willing to extend the tour timing to allow us to see everything planned.  Great customer service!  He was very knowledgeable about all the stops and with the power assisted bikes, we were definitely able to see more of the city than we would have in the same time frame with regular bikes.  Loved the bikes so much, even looked as to how to get one for our own use! I would definitely recommend this tour above any other tour that uses regular bicycles.  Also, he stated he normally only takes 4 people so its an intimate experience. My family of 3 were the only ones on the tour so it was great to have that individualized attention. The cost is a little higher than what I was originally thinking we would pay for any tour, but in the end it was totally worth it.  My husband who would normally complain about that, never made a peep and was totally excited about the tour and found it to be a good value for the money and our time.  Highly recommend Adam and his tour!!

reviews.title: OMG ... Where do I start ?
text: The best way to see Toronto ever.  Adam was the perfect tour guide showing us spots we would never have discovered.  The electric bikes made it an easy ride and such a personal way to see the city. We had such a fun day. I couldn't fault anything.  10 stars Adam. Thanks again.
Sue and Ted - Adelaide, South Australia
